intro: Muraltia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved muraltia, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, including South Africa, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, often thorny stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, arranged in small clusters, and it produces small, round pods containing edible seeds. Muraltia parvifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
